result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Absolute sobriety.
No alcohol.
No controlled substances without a prescription. 
No drug paraphernalia.
No contact with JMJ, RRA, JBA or BJS. No contact with Nilssen's Market in Clear Lake. 
No contact with Dion Rutcosky, Katlyn Walker, or Tyler Long unless otherwise approved or modified by agent. 
No possession of firearms or ammunition. No possession of baseball bats.
Must make good faith effort to obtain high school diploma, GED or HSED.

Must follow all conditions and rules of probation.
Must complete any programming or treatment required by agent. 
Must complete Cognitive Thinking or Breaking Barriers course or similar course approved by agent.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

timeConds.notes: Stayed/banked for use by Probation. Not subject to good time. Subject to work release.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony James Silbernagel

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 22, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Ext. supervision conditions modification hearing on November 22, 2022 at 10:45 am.
to Revoke DAGP - Counts 1 & 14
Counts 7, 9 and 10
DNA Submission Acknowledgment Form
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea agreement - Counts 1 and 14
Counts 1 and 14

CASES: 22CF40, 22CF52, 21CM125. 10:15 AM Defendant Anthony James Silbernagel in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Anthony James Silbernagel. Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. ADA to file amended information in 22CF40. Copy of amended information provided to court.  Felony warnings given re loss of firearms, loss of voting rights, citizenship rights etc. Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea agreement with state on felony counts 1 and 14 in 22CF40- 5 years. DAGP reviewed with def. $150 DAGP fee to DA's office. 

22CF52 count 2- def- G plea. 22CF52 count 3 - def- G plea.
22CF40 amended count 1 fel theft from person- def-G plea. 22CF40 count 7- def- G plea. 
22CF40 count 9 - def- G plea. 22CF40 count 10 - def- G plea. 22CF40 count 14 fel- def- G plea.
CT finds grounds to accept plea on ct 1 and 14 but does not do so at this time due to Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea agreement. 
CT accepts pleas on cts 7,9, 10, adj G, judgment entered. 
CT accepts pleas on cts 2 and 3 in 22CF52, adj G, judgment entered.  Other remaining counts/files DRI'd without predj without costs.
ADA Webster- argument. Atty Chapman- argument. Def addresses court. 

SENTENCE:
22CF52 Count 2 misd resisting officer: Fine waived. $200 DNA surcharge and sample. W/held 3 years probation on each count.   

Count 3 misd retail theft: $265.60 fine/costs, $200 DNA surcharge and sample.
$47.11 restitution includes the 10% surcharge to Nilssen's Market, plus a 5% surcharge. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. All $ payable to COCC as a condition of probation. Ftp- judgement.  

22CF40: Count 7 misd battery PTAC: W/held 3 years probation on each count. 
$265.60 fine/costs, $200 DNA surcharge and sample.  6 months stayed/banked jail. Not subj to GT. Subj to WR. 
Count 9 misd theft PTAC: Fine waived.  $200 DNA surcharge and sample. 
Count 10 misd theft PTAC: Fine waived. $200 DNA surcharge and sample. 
 
Probation conditions on all: AODA and comply, AS, No alcohol, No controlled substances without a prescription, no drug paraphernalia. 
No contact with JMJ, RRA, JBA or BJS. No contact with Nilssen's Market in Clear Lake. 
No possession of firearms or ammunition. No possession of baseball bats. Make good faith effort to obtain high school diploma, GED/HSED. Follow all conditions/rules of probation. Any programming/treatment required by agent. Cognitive thinking or Breaking barriers course. No contact with Dion Rutcosky, Katlyn Walker or Tyler Long unless otherwise modified by agent. Must report to probation today. Counsel to submit sentence credit within 2 weeks.  PCR. 11:08 am adj. 
*Counsel stipulates to 4 days credit.
Warrant Cancellation/Return from Dispatch  07/14/2022 22CF52, 22CF40,  21CM125
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

12:51 PM CASES: 22CF52, 22CF40 & 21CM125 Prosecuting attorney Benjamin James Webster appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony James Silbernagel in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Anthony James Silbernagel. CH-Clerk Atty Chapman makes statement regarding missed court appearance and requests warrants be quashed. State requests to reschedule. Ct. quashes warrants and reschedules matters. Bond cont. 1:28 pm adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
- Bench Warrant Issued

CASES: 21CF125, 22CF40 & 22CF52.  10:48 AM Defendant Anthony James Silbernagel not in court.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Anthony James Silbernagel. CW-clerk. 
ADA-request bench warrant, WI & MN. CT-warrants auth, held until 1 pm today. 10:50 am adj.

CASES: 22CF40 & 22CF52. Prosecuting attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony James Silbernagel in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Anthony James Silbernagel. 2:23 p.m. AO-Clerk. Bond cont. 2:25 p.m. adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge- filed by atty Chapman

CASES: ARGN in 22CF52 and 22CF40, STC in 21CM125. 2:37 PM. JL-Clerk.  Defendant Anthony James Silbernagel in court.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Anthony James Silbernagel. Reading waived, plea NG. Defense is preserved 15 days on prearraignment rights. Bond cont. 2:38 pm adj

CASES: 22CF40 & 22CF52. 03:01 PM. JL-Clerk. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court with attorney Benjamin James Webster. Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Defendant Anthony James Silbernagel.
22CF52: State calls officer Langer - S&T. CT finds identification made. Cross by Atty Chapman. Argument by parties. CT finds PC, def bound over for trial. 
22CF40: State calls Inv. Rorvick - S&T. CT finds identification made. Cross by Atty Chapman. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. Bond cont. 3:34 pm adj.

Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony James Silbernagel
Current: 844 100th St, Amery, WI 54001 United States  (Effective: 02-28-2022)
Prior: 120 Maple Street, Clear Lake, WI 54005

COVERS CASES: 22CF40 & 22CF52.   Not to have contact with: co-defendants Dion Rutcosky, Katlyn Walker, Tyler Long, RRA, BJS, JBA, GB.  No use or possession of firearms. Absolute Sobriety.  Not to possess or consume alcohol.  No controlled substances without a prescription.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Not to have contact with: Nilssen's Market at 265 5th St NW, Clear Lake, WI 54005.

CASES: 22CF40 & 22CF52. Defendant Anthony James Silbernagel in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2:17 p.m. AO-Clerk. 22CF40 - de has rec'd CC, waive reading. 20CF52 - De has rec'd CC, waive reading. De qualifies, SPD has a conflict. State requests sig bond to cover both cases. Ct sets bond. WSPH. 2:28 p.m. adj.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
